Does anyone has good library for rxjs + socket.io? how can i disconnect from a websocket automatically when no component using it in the dom? i dont want to hold many websockets because its resource consuming or atleast thats what i think it is, correct me if im wrong. i want kind of lazy usage of websockets is it possible?
lihaibh: use the websocket subject in rxjs or wrap your websocket into an observable and share it
and how would i know when to disconnect?
when all subscribers unsubscribe then the dispose function will be executed as long as you “share” it.  I think share has been removed so you would need to run .publishReplay(1).refcount().
publishReplay? not regular 'publish'?

I had to implement an operator that delayed the dispose though, because since changing routes will destroy the components before the new ones are created and the websocket connection will be torn down. It’s to share only 1 version of the websocket

Newbie question: why would it be that my styles.scss file’s variables wouldn’t be available to a component? I’m getting “undefined variable” even though the variable is declared in my top level style.scss file.
etsuo: you need to import the styles.scss in to the components style sheet or you need to add it to the styleUrls
jjstreet: where’s the styleUrls?
[<-CODE->]
Oh…. i see…
so it doesn’t get imported top level? like in the index.html?
scss is a preprocessed language, so you can't import them into html like any other css file
right, but I would have expected style.scss to be compiled down to style.css. that’s the global style
right
but variables in that file aren't magically available to other scss files, you have to import that styles.scss file into them
OOOOO i get it… thanks@jjstreet
sorry, so I tried:[<-CODE->] but I’m still getting Undefined variable: "$colors”when I try to access the $colors variable defined in the styles.sass file that’s meant for global styles… :/?
etsuo: try doing import in the app.component.scss file

Hello, I am new in A2. I am trying to develop an app where users fill the search form and click search button , it sends request to API to get results. This search form is in one component and I want to display the search result in another component on the same web page. How can I make so that when I click search button in "searchform" component, the result will be displayed in "results" component ? I have searchservice to handle the http request. How can i make connection with search button to trigger to load the result lists in result component ?

@sayedrakib If your components are siblings then try to send event to the parent component to initialize the results to some variable say <srch_results> and using the bindings for the results component set one to get <srch_results>  and do what ever you want with that data in your results component.You can do it via services, Observables too.But if the results is a child component then you can do it directly thinking a bit will give you the sol.And for more on this read about component interacion cookbook on angular 2 website.https://angular.io/docs/ts/latest/cookbook/component-communication.html

Hi All, I need to have a tabs in my app. each tab will load its own component. so there would be parent component which will have 3 tabs and each tab will load its own component when user clicks on it. any solution to achieve this ?
vishalgajjar: Exactly what you just said lol
Just make the tabs with router Links and a <router-outlet> underneath
HauntedSmores: there is already one router-outlet in the application so how to target the child router-outlet.?

vishalgajjar: You may need to structure your app a little differently. You cant have more than one router outlet in a single component. Lets say you have Component A with its child component, Component B, which will hold the tabs. Then you have one <router-outlet> that pulls in your top level components. INSIDE component A you have another <router-outlet> That pulls in and routes to your different tabs
